content.description: Easy boulder route, more hand work than foot work. Follow the line of crimps and ledges up the middle of the face. Very fun to send, with a fun little top out. Hardest part would be getting up over the little bulge after the second ledge.
content.location: The route is in the middle of the crag, next to an obvious borehole. Pretty much find the ledge at the middle and start up the face. You can modify the route to be harder or easier, as there are both large and small crimps up the face.

content.description: Little 10-20 ft bouldering wall next to the road. Fairly easy, mostly crimpy climbs. What makes this wall stand out is the incredible friction of the rock. Looks like sandstone, but it grips like conglomerate. The wall itself is man made, where they blasted for a road, and not very steep. Great for warming up, plus there's a pull off about twenty yards away from it.
